words.def: an important, honorable person (word is often used humorously)
vehemently incensed and condemnatory
The whortleberry, or bilberry.
the act of throwing (propelling something with a rapid movement of the arm and wrist)
an indefinite quantity of something having a specified value
Composed of, or resembling, tow.
A farmer or tiller of the soil.
trust or faith.
Eagre; earnest; vehement.
an American who favored the British side during the American Revolution
someone new to a field or activity
usually used in combination: `liverwort'
a system of weights used for precious metals and gemstones
the cause or intention underlying an action or situation, especially in the phrase `the whys and wherefores'
humorously sarcastic or mocking
The means by which something is accomplished.
a flatbottom boat for carrying heavy loads (especially on canals)
a United Nations agency to coordinate international health activities and to help governments improve health services
To know.
earnest and conscientious activity intended to do or accomplish something
the cardinal number that is the sum of one and one or a numeral representing this number
used of physical heat
an artifact designed to be played with
the act of hauling something (as a vehicle) by means of a hitch or rope
a branch of the Tai languages
an arrangement of objects or people side by side in a line
the 17th letter of the Greek alphabet
a state of decay usually accompanied by an offensive odor
a prominent rock or pile of rocks on a hill
Usually in plural orts A fragment; a scrap of leftover food; any remainder; a piece of refuse.
a trivalent metallic element of the rare earth group
a midwestern state in north central United States in the Great Lakes region
Toward a closed, touching or engaging position.
a state in northwestern United States on the Pacific
